title: The End Times Revelation
shortSummary: Daniel 12 reveals prophetic insights about the final days, including a time of unprecedented trouble, resurrection, judgment, and ultimate deliverance for God's people. It emphasizes the rise of Michael as protector, the sealing of the prophecy until the end, and the promise of blessing for those who remain faithful.
timeline: c. 6th century BC - Babylonian Exile, prophetic vision concerning the end times

keyCharacters.name: Daniel
keyCharacters.description: The prophet receiving and recording the vision concerning the end times and resurrection.

keyCharacters.name: Michael
keyCharacters.description: The great prince and protector of God's people who will stand up during the time of trouble.

keyCharacters.name: Man clothed in linen
keyCharacters.description: A heavenly figure who provides Daniel with the timeline and explanation of the end-time events.

definitions.definition: An archangel described as the great prince who stands for the children of Israel, often seen as a protector and warrior angel.
A prophetic expression meaning a period of three and a half years, often associated with tribulation.
A sacrilegious act or object that causes desolation, referring to a future event where the daily sacrifice is stopped and a desecration occurs.
To close and protect the prophecy from understanding until the appointed time of fulfillment.

outline.heading: The Time of Trouble and Deliverance
outline.description: Michael rises to defend God's people during an unprecedented time of distress, resulting in resurrection and eternal reward for the wise and righteous.

outline.heading: The Sealing of the Prophecy and Increase of Knowledge
outline.description: Daniel is instructed to seal the words until the end, with a vision of two others by the river and a solemn oath detailing the duration of the tribulation.

outline.heading: Daniel's Question and the Explanation of the End
outline.description: Daniel expresses confusion about the vision, receiving reassurance that understanding will come to the wise at the time of the end, while the wicked remain ignorant.

outline.heading: The Specific Timelines of the End
outline.description: The prophecy gives precise day counts related to the cessation of the daily sacrifice and the setting up of the abomination, promising blessing to those who endure to the end.

outline.heading: Daniel's Rest and Future Reward
outline.description: Daniel is encouraged to rest until the end of days when he will arise to receive his allotted inheritance.

application: Trust in God's sovereign protection during times of trial, knowing He raises up defenders like Michael for His people.
Seek wisdom and righteousness, as these qualities will shine eternally and lead others to salvation.
Be patient and faithful, even when prophetic truths seem sealed or unclear, trusting that understanding will come in God's timing.
Remain steadfast in obedience and prayer, awaiting the promised resurrection and eternal reward.

keyVerses.text: And at that time shall Michael stand up, the great prince which standeth for the children of thy people: and there shall be a time of trouble, such as never was since there was a nation even to that same time: and at that time thy people shall be delivered, every one that shall be found written in the book.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God's protection through Michael and the unprecedented tribulation before deliverance.

keyVerses.text: And many of them that sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake, some to everlasting life, and some to shame and everlasting contempt.
keyVerses.significance: It reveals the doctrine of resurrection and final judgment, foundational to Christian hope.

keyVerses.text: But thou, O Daniel, shut up the words, and seal the book, even to the time of the end: many shall run to and fro, and knowledge shall be increased.
keyVerses.significance: This verse explains the sealing of prophecy and foretells an increase in knowledge as the end approaches.

keyVerses.text: But go thou thy way till the end be: for thou shalt rest, and stand in thy lot at the end of the days.
keyVerses.significance: It offers encouragement to remain faithful, promising rest and reward at the end of time.
